title: Conor McGregor announces UFC return in January and Nate Diaz trilogy fight
text:
McGregor says he will fight in January (Picture: Getty)

Conor McGregor has announced he will fight in January in his UFC comeback against an unnamed opponent.

The Irishman confirmed he would return to the octagon in a surprise announcement at a press conference in Moscow.

McGregor said he would fight in Las Vegas on 18 January and would then fight the winner of Nate Diaz vs Jorge Masvidal.

‘I have agreed the date with the company,’ McGregor said.

McGregor wants to fight Diaz after his January bout (Picture: Getty)

‘As far as the opponent, I have the opponent’s name, but from experience if I know if I give you the name the UFC would flip it. They are a crafty company.

‘Ask the UFC who the opponent is because I do not give a f*** who the opponent is.

‘January 18th, the return of the Notorious Conor McGregor, 12 weeks from today at the T-Mobile Arena, Las Vegas, Nevada. That will be the beginning of my season.

‘I will then look to compete against the winner of the Nate Diaz-Jorge Masvidal for the Bad Motherf***er title.

‘Obviously I have history with Nate Diaz and we are set to make the trilogy bout. I feel Nate will get the better of that one.

McGregor says a rematch with Nurmagomedov will happen in 2020 (Picture: Getty)

‘Then I will seek the Moscow bout. It will be against the winner of Tony Ferguson and Khabib Nurmagomedov.

‘I can’t even say the guy’s name, who gives a f*** what the guy’s name is. That is the bout we want. We want the bout in Russia.’

The UFC are yet to comment on McGregor’s announcement, but it is believed the frontrunners to face the former lightweight and featherweight champion in January are Donald ‘Cowboy’ Cerrone and Justin Gaethje.
